content: 77 79 row or until your work measures around 19 19 20 20 22 24 26 28 30 32 from the point where you divided the back and the front finish with a ws row now you will separate the shoulders and bind off the stitches for the neck the basic tee has a large boat neck if you prefer a narrow one just increase the number of stitches for the shoulders and bind off fewer stitches for the neck knit 15 17 18 20 22 24 27 29 33 36 stitches and put them on hold bind off 44 48 50 52 56 60 64 68 70 72 stitches knit 15 17 18 20 22 24 27 29 33 36 stitches and put them on hold front same as the back shoulders join the shoulders using the grafting technique or any other technique you like to join live stitches sleeves with the 4 mm needles pick up 54 54 56 58 60 66 72 76 82 84 stitches for the sleeve on either side of the shoulder seam the stitches should be picked up starting at the center of the underarm i like to pick up one stitch every other row all over the sleeve except under the arms under the arms i pick one stitch every row so there are no unpleasant holes in the fabric place a stitch marker at the center of the underarm and join to work in the round work for 26 28 28 28 30 30 32 32 36 36 row or until the sleeve measures around 10 11 11 11 12 12 13 13 14 14 cm change to the 3 5 mm needles and work 6 row of rib k1 p1 or until the rib measures around 2 cm bind off using the ribbed sewn 1x1 technique or any other bind-off you like obs if you choose to bind off using the ribbed sewn 1x1 technique you can stop after 5 row of rib and that s it you should have a minimalist cotton tee to wear this summer if you knit this pattern i would like to have your feedback if you post on instagram tag me @minimalistknitting or use the hashtag #minimalistcottontee on your photos abbreviations k1 - knit 1 stitch p1 - purl 1 stitch ws - wrong side
